website_summaries.verdict: An attractive countertop unit with a big interior and plenty of features.
pros: Large enough to fit a 5 lbs
Sleek and durable stainless steel design
Quick-heating and has a useful 2-hour timer
cons: Doesn’t have an interior light and the unit gets very hot

customer_reviews.title: No parts available
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for almost 2 years and use it almost daily. It's an amazing addition to our kitchen. Today I turned the timer knob to preheat it and the Nov broke off. I thought it was no big deal I'll just order a new one from Hamilton Beach. Nope. They don't offer replacement parts except the racks and rotisserie pieces. They expect me to throw a perfectly good piece of equipment away for what would probably be a $5 part of it were available anywhere which it's not. So what was a 5+ star review is now 2. Hopefully epoxy will fix the knob but that shouldn't be necessary
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: The Hamilton Beach Countertop Oven is awesome! It is large
customer_reviews.text: The Hamilton Beach Countertop Oven is awesome! It is large, holds 2 pizzas at the same time, and can rotisserie a whole chicken. The oven is beautiful in stainless steel and fits my kitchen decor. The temperatures are true to the dial and my food cooks evenly. I hardly ever use my large oven anymore! Oven comes with 2 racks, large broiler tray and small tray. The oven does get hot on top, so be careful. This was my favorite Amazon purchase thus far. I highly recommend this oven. Oh and it makes perfect toast, as well...
customer_reviews.author: Lola P.

customer_reviews.title: So quiet you may think its not working.
customer_reviews.text: From the reviews I read, I expected a loud oven that worked well. And I believe the other reviewers who said when it was on convection made it was loud. Well, Hamilton Beach must have fixed this. The oven ran so silently that I thought the convection mode was not working. It is, and as the other folks said it works quickly. If you need a countertop oven, this is the one to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaiiansteve_o

customer_reviews.title: 5-Year or More Usage - Not!
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, enough this fine Stainless Steel Countertop Toaster Oven with Rotisserie was purchased 6/30/16. Stopped working 11/7/2018 (slightly over 2 years). Timer keeps ticking, but no Power. Disappointed that the 'Non-Stick' surface is ONLY ON THE SIDES not the complete interior; however, it performed and satisfied all cooking/baking/heating needs. Oven was used 3-4 times a week. Wish it lasts much longer (ie Kenmore Waffle/Pancake Cooker for over 30 years, Teflon - easy clean up and heavy duty Stainless steel - Sears Purchase)
customer_reviews.author: Katrese

customer_reviews.title: 300° Max. Cheap junk
customer_reviews.text: I needed 400°+ for roasting peppers, coffee and making pizza. Sad to say I'm another customer that found out the hard way that the 450-500° rating is a lie. I gave it 30min to get up to temp and my precision digital thermometer read 305°. My coffee was ruined by taking 62 minutes to reach correct color when it should be under 15 minutes if the temp was actually 450°+
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had it about a month and I’ve barely had to use the regular oven since. The rotisserie function was why I picked this unit, and it’s been used weekly since we’ve gotten it. Cooks perfectly each time! Teeneage boys also prefer to use this because there’s less worry they will burn themselves. Comes with enough accessories to handle everything we cook. Great purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: DJB

customer_reviews.title: Not as big as expected.
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for when our old oven went out. The rotisserie function is nice because we can cook a whole chicken in it which we couldn't do without burning the top in our last one but it's not as wide so several of my baking dishes won't fit. While that isn't the fault of the oven I do have issues setting the temp without having to put my face 6 inches from the dial and turning the timer dial can be absolutely impossible if your hands aren't completely dry. They really should have put some grooves or something on the dial for grip. In the end it works but I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: joanna e

customer_reviews.title: Why is it so hard to tell the truth
customer_reviews.text: I just received this and am disappointed that 9×13 pans will not fit in oven, I have not used it to cook with yet.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Mills

customer_reviews.title: Read the instructions before use it won't take long.
customer_reviews.text: Just made a rotisserie chicken and it turned out great. One of the reviews complains of being burned by the oven. If you read the directions you'll see mention that touching parts other than the handle and control knobs will likely result in burns while the oven is hot. The design makes cleaning very simple.
customer_reviews.author: Rumplestiltskin

customer_reviews.title: Slow cook time and extremely hot body
customer_reviews.text: It takes 2 times longer than my smaller toaster oven also by Hamilton Beach, and exactly 2 times longer than instruction to bake a frozen personal pizza. Moreover, the body gets extremely hot like the force around a Sith Lord so strong that even I can feel the high heat by standing beside it. Sorry I have to return it and exchange with a similar size/design one. I do like the size, bigger than toaster oven yet smaller than regular oven.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: We are otherwise delighted with the oven and now rotisserie
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I am not giving this 5 stars is we had to return the original unit after we discovered tbe rotisserie didn't rotate. This was a month after the purchase arrived. The return /exchange was swift, smooth and hassle-free. We are otherwise delighted with the oven and now rotisserie! It replaces another Hamilton Beach oven with similar features that we had for 5 years and are passing on to our son. We used that oven multiple times per day and I am certain the new oven will be equally trustworthy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Toaster Oven
customer_reviews.text: For me this is a great toaster oven. I have not used the rotisseri but the convention setting only seems to make more noise but not cook any faster. The feature I needed the most was to be able to fit larger pans in and is a great little oven.
customer_reviews.author: Julie B.

customer_reviews.title: I found this to be the best of its type available
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a toaster and we also wanted a small countertop oven. Use it every day as a convection oven mostly. Have not tried the Rotisserie part yet but I did find this option desirable when choosing this model. Hope to use it soon. For the price, I found this to be the best of its type available. Very easy to clean. There is a "crumb tray" that slides out easily for cleaning. The knobs are easy to use but I find the labelling just a tad small for quickly identifying the selection to make. This is just a personal preference for me and does not hinder the usability of the oven in any significant way.
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for the price
customer_reviews.text: Love this oven. It has a large capacity without being bulky. I would be sure to check the size of your countertop before making the purchase. It cooks wonderfully, I use it for everything. I love all of the racks and pans it came with. The finishes on the inside and outside are very classic and clean looking. It is a nice addition to my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Rebeccaloves2shop

customer_reviews.title: the convection went out within the first year
customer_reviews.text: the appliance didn't shut off and I didn't know it and nearly had a fire when I caught it being so terribly hot. It must have ruined the convection part because it just bakes now. I started to get another one because I bought a year warranty but I got caught up in too many other personal problems to solve and forgot to do it yet. It gets sooo hot on the outside that it is very dangerous. I have burned myself many times by touching some part of the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Ned

customer_reviews.title: Very good oven.
customer_reviews.text: I have had many countertop ovens over the years, and they don't make 'em like they used to. They are very lightweight and get hot on the outside, unlike some of the older units I had. But this one is a very good oven, nice looking, easy to use (unlike the Oster Extra Large Digital Oven, which I also have!) My only only complaint, and this is why it is 4 stars instead of five, is that I cannot fit MY 9x13 casserole in there. The Oster will accept it but this one is just too small. However I don't use the casserole much, and this oven is our daily go-to cooking appliance.
customer_reviews.author: HSHOBX

customer_reviews.title: Could be better. But adequate for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room but>>>>>> No interior light. Very slow rebound when baking frozen foods(pizza). Numbers,settings small print and very difficult to read. This is especially true of the temp.settings. Purchased a oven thermometer to be sure I am the right temp.
customer_reviews.author: Jeepster

customer_reviews.title: Decent basic countertop oven, without a lot of frills
customer_reviews.text: No preheat function, the temperature setting is not easy to set precisely. The rotisserie function works well. We were able to cook a five pound standing rib roast an four pound ham and they both turned out to be very tasty.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: I love, love
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this countertop oven, but be aware that it's more oven than toaster. Two roomy shelves, nice roasting spit, really adjustable. Pretty easy to clean. Bakes cakes, pies, pizza comes out perfect every time. Roasts meats or sausages or veggies (use a basket to roast corn for the best street corn style corn on the cob you'll make at home). It's pretty much the center of my kitchen, but it makes so-so toast. It doesn't have a setting for toast. I use the bake setting at full heat, no convection, and it comes out okay.
customer_reviews.author: Season C.

customer_reviews.title: I'm enjoying baking again
customer_reviews.text: My regular stove oven hasn't ignited (not even when I use a match) for several years. I became adept at skillet and microwave baking. When I noticed this oven was on a pretty good sale I splurged. Now, I'm enjoying oven-baked goods again. Nicely browned biscuits, baked and rotisserie chicken and today a properly baked turkey breast. Wow!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five stars
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the oven due to broiler didn't work and the oven only heated up to 325 I am giving it a second chance hopefuly it will be good! I will update the item once I get to test the new one arriving on Tuesday 😀fMake sure to read the directions for preheating this oven this is the problem i had before i discovered rhe right way to do it update I love this oven !
customer_reviews.author: Michael Quimby

customer_reviews.title: I don't like the numbers on the dial it's rather difficult to ...
customer_reviews.text: It does the job of heating up pizzas without turning off the regular oven. I don't like the numbers on the dial it's rather difficult to see the temp you want. I have to get eye level to the oven because if you look down on it it's hard to tell what temp you are setting it . I have it on a little cart that is a little lower than my counter. But my old toaster oven had a better temperature dial which was clear to read and set.
customer_reviews.author: Regina C

customer_reviews.title: Received product with dented handle
customer_reviews.text: The oven is great, love the rotisserie, but the oven handle was severely damaged when we got it. My wife and I discussed returning but it was an open box on prime day. Open box description did not list item as dented. Listed it as like new. So returning would mean paying a lot more for a replacement. We decided to live with the dent, but beware they can come damaged.
customer_reviews.author: == true;

customer_reviews.title: Convection is nice, the oven bakes and broils exactly like it ...
customer_reviews.text: The oven works extraordinarily well. Convection is nice, the oven bakes and broils exactly like it should. Only downside is that the outside gets REALLY hot. Must be poorly insulated. We deal with it, but I wish it could be cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan C. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Even cooking
customer_reviews.text: This oven does take up a lot of space on the counter but is well worth the space it takes. It definitely minimizes the use of an oven and sits nicely on the counter. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Deann

customer_reviews.title: just because I like to. Easy to keep clean and keeps the ...
customer_reviews.text: Having this oven now makes me wonder why I didn’t get one sooner. I thought preheating every time would be a hassle but I just turn the dial as soon as I start preparing whatever I’m cooking. I use mostly the Convection setting; just because I like to. Easy to keep clean and keeps the kitchen from heating up like my gas oven does.
customer_reviews.author: Helen from Georgia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! I use it in my studio on a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my dedicated polymer clay oven. Perfect! I use it in my studio on a pedestal away from the wall. I have placed quarry tile on the wall to make sure the wall doesn't get hot. The unit does get hot - top, sides, front and back, so use care not to burn yourself, and definitely keep away from the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Katie - Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last a year
customer_reviews.text: We bought this b/c our previous one finally gave out and this was the current version. Our older over last for YEARS. This one had problems early on...the knob would get stuck and wouldn't turn easily. A few weeks ago I turned it on to cook something and the power came on but no heat functions work. Already dead, less than an yr after we purchased it. Disappointing!!
customer_reviews.author: Kit Kat

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: I like this toaster oven a lot, my boyfriend and I cook full meals in it all the time. It can fit a lot of food and cooks a lot faster than a big oven. It does get pretty hot on the outside so don’t set things on top of it and just be careful. I’m glad I got this one as opposed to a smaller toaster oven bevause we end up using both racks most of the time. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia C D

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: I've used HB products for years, and never had any problems until my purchase of this toaster oven. I used it about 3 times, when the dialing knob broke. When l contacted Customer Service, they said they didn't have replacement knobs, but would give me a discount on a new oven. This was an obviously less than desirable answer.
customer_reviews.author: M. Teichman

customer_reviews.title: It does not heat up my whole kitchen like the range oven did
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding tool. Have used every feature. It does not heat up my whole kitchen like the range oven did. Speaking of which, my electric range committed suicide, via electrocution, 4-years ago. Was quite a site to behold, like a bunch of sparklers going off at once; when one of my electric burners exploded. This is the first time I have had an oven since. Can't get the existing stove out, to replace it; it's got a cabinet stuck on top of it...literally. This oven is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: GailAnn Gray

customer_reviews.title: Great Oven!
customer_reviews.text: I love this countertop oven! Spacious, simple controls, accurate temperatures, great for baking or broiling. Haven't tried the rotisserie yet, but I'm sure it's a good thing, too. Highly recommend this little oven. I bought it to replace an old one that I had loved and used daily--I love this one even more!!
customer_reviews.author: Max's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Like it even with a slight issue in the beginning.
customer_reviews.text: This oven is huge. It did have its issues in the beginning. The bottom element did not work. We called the on the warranty. They (Hamilton Beach) sent us a new one with just a picture of the unit disabled and a copy of the receipt. This second unit works like a charm. I would recommend this oven even with the small issue we had. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Csablich

customer_reviews.title: Best convection oven
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. I haven't used my regular oven since getting this. It cools faster and the foods I have cooked have come out juicer and taste so much better than cooking in the regular oven. I have cooked steaks, chicken, pork chops and they all have turned out even better than cooking on the grill. I absolutely love doing rotisserie foods they turn out so juicy and full of flavor. It's perfect .
customer_reviews.author: Kim Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: For what it is it's a good oven, and does a good job
customer_reviews.text: For what it is it's a good oven, and does a good job. I wouldn't not purchase this if you have young children the exterior gets extremely hot though. I purchased it for the rotisserie and it works well for that. I think I would have been better off to purchase a dedicated vertical rotisserie oven, but that's hindsight for ya. This unit is more versatile though. They should consider reworking the knobs without perfectly dry hands they are hard to rotate and a oven temperature display would be nice as well. Still at the price point it's a great value that can delivers exceptional results.
customer_reviews.author: Ineffable

customer_reviews.title: Great iven
customer_reviews.text: I love this oven. Does everything I need without using the big oven and heating up the house. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Lynnette Randall

customer_reviews.title: It'll work...for a while.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this oven in Nov 2014 and the wife loved it. We also purchased the Asurion Protection Plan in case it failed. The unit did fail and was replaced by Asurion. The problem was the function knob that you use to select "bake" broke......on both units. Two ovens with the same problem lasted just shy of 4 years (Sept 2018). I won't be buying this unit again. I could have replaced the defective part myself but parts are not available.
customer_reviews.author: CraigH

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: According to my oven thermometer, my oven only heats to 350 degrees when it's set for 450.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Oven was in perfect shape and all the parts were included
customer_reviews.text: Bought the non-commercial packaged product at deep discount. Was concerned what we might get at 30% off the price, but as specified the only thing wrong was the outside of the box was scuffed up. Oven was in perfect shape and all the parts were included. We have used it to bake pizzas, biscuits, casserole, and rotisserie both a 4 lbs chicken and an 8 lbs turkey. Worked perfectly with no issues. I dropped one star due to the outside being a bit too hot during use. Not a fire hazard, but too hot to touch. I recommend this oven.
customer_reviews.author: Waitforclick

customer_reviews.title: Love the Size
customer_reviews.text: Big and fits all my pans. Don't know if the temps as started since I haven't tested with a thermometer or anything but seems okay. The all sides do indeed get hot, but with it sitting 9-10" from the bottom of my cabinets; I've not had problems with excessive heat. Just be smart about this beasts placement.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Very poor temp control, badly marked and inaccurate. Convection fan failed before a year was out. Rotisserie awkward to load. Pretty much a waste of money if you are a serious cook.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Haemmerle

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and functioning oven
customer_reviews.text: Have had this oven a few weeks and have been very happy and impressed. Sturdy construction with solid controls make cooking easy. Used the rotisserie feature on the oven for the first time and ended up with a great roast that cooked faster than I thought. Would recommend to anyone looking for a larger size countertop oven. Updated 2/25/18 Oven is used almost daily and performing great. Really enjoy the rotisserie feature and use it more often than I thought. Cooking a 3lb roast on it right now. Kitchen smells wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Needsilver

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: This is used mainly for testing different recipies without the need to fire up a full size oven. We've had no problem with it at all and the bake times seem correct. We've done homemade breads and several homemade deep dish pizzas in this oven and it worked perfectly every time. The outside of the oven does get hot, but so does every other counter top oven we've had. That's not something so unusual.
customer_reviews.author: Jim D

customer_reviews.title: So close to being useful but...
customer_reviews.text: Not Impressed. My 9 x 13 baking dish almost fits but it has a little handle on each end. So now I need to find baking dishes that do not exceed 13" with the handle included. It doesn't heat up very quickly. Tried to broil a bagel and the butter didn't melt for almost 5 minutes. Can't wait to see how long it takes to melt cheese.
customer_reviews.author: Painterguy1

customer_reviews.title: Serious burn risk!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you find one of these, do not buy it!!! It is a serious burn risk. If you happen to touch the frame that the handle is attached to, you will likely get a first degree burn if not a second degree. Even a short touch will cause this. It's likely that is why this is discontinued. I can't fathom how this passed internally testing.
customer_reviews.author: James W Stewart Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great rotisserie and for toasted sandwiches, not so great for straight-up toast
customer_reviews.text: It CAN work as a toaster but it's not quick or efficient for that job. I like to make toasted sandwiches and it does that really well, but takes about 10 minutes (use the convection setting). It's great as a rotisserie, though. I did two cornish hens on it for about 1.5 hours. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: SabbyATL

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have made so many rotisserie chickens in this oven. I also love that it has a couple of racks, so that we can do gluten free on the top, and non-gluten free on the bottom and not have to have a separate toaster. Honestly, it's also a pretty appliance that's easy to clean, and that's also a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah R.

customer_reviews.title: Hot
customer_reviews.text: I kept it long enough to heat it up to temperature. If I could score at zero I would do that. It gets so hot on the outside you would get a blister if you touched. I believe it’s a real fire hazard. Sorry Hamilton Beach this one is a dud.
customer_reviews.author: Crwmgm

customer_reviews.title: its ok
customer_reviews.text: i bought this to replace my convection oven .. 1. it has NO toast button or setting. 2. No defrost. i have not used the rotisserie setting yet.. I am not overly impressed with it .. however i cooks pizzas and potpies and other baked products ok.
customer_reviews.author: Kittymama

customer_reviews.title: Safer than a microwave.
customer_reviews.text: It took some getting used to but love it!!! It heats up fast & keeps my kitchen cooler than using the big oven. I love it! I recommend it if you are trying to do things healthier this is for you!
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: Most important item in my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews before I bought this. I have had it for a little more that a week now and I love it. I'm wondering how I got along without one this far. I can cook most of my meals in it, It's easy to clean up, and I can put two pizzas in it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: pay attention to size, not just features.  It has everything anyone would want.
customer_reviews.text: everything was as advertised, but the unit is just too large for my needs. the ad didn't give the measurements, and I'm not willing to give it that much counter space. I will be returning it
customer_reviews.author: Luann Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! Wonderful to use in summer as it doesn't heat the kitchen like the big stove would. Never had a convection oven before so I am still getting used to the heat/time adjustment, but would highly recommend it. I have cooked frozen appetizers (which got crunchier with convection vs. bake) and pizza. even tried bread but didn't cook long enough on convection setting. the size is nice too. I can fit a metal 9X13 pan it comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: StarLily

customer_reviews.title: Cooks great but the spits/forks for the rotisserie suck
customer_reviews.text: Makes great chicken, but the forks to stick into the bird itself are small, short, and don't like to stay tight. They are so narrow there is no way to get them secure in the bottom part of the bird so it tends to flop leaving one side to get cooked well, and the other side to not get cooked as well because it flops and spins past the heating elements in a second. There are no larger/better spits you can buy from the manufacturer
customer_reviews.author: dc

customer_reviews.title: This Toaster Is Amazing
customer_reviews.text: When I Bought this I completely forgot this had a Rotisserie function bought 2 Cornish Hen they fit perfectly. and they came out great, family loved it. definiely recomend
customer_reviews.author: Guy who buys stuff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent find!
customer_reviews.text: This oven is excellent. Cant imagine my life without it. I bought it because our wall oven went out and I didnt have the money to replace it right away but now even with the wall oven operating we still use this 2 or 3 times a day. I have 6 kids that are always making something in it from baking cookies and spinning a chicken on the rotisserie to making 2 large thick frozen pizzas at once. LOVE IT!!!!! PRICE WAS FANTASTIC!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Cooks well. But you constantly burn yourself as the ...
customer_reviews.text: Cooks well. But you constantly burn yourself as the metal piece under the handle goes way too hot for the outside of a machine. And often when you open it you get burnt.
customer_reviews.author: ml

customer_reviews.title: Good toaster oven
customer_reviews.text: Nice size toaster oven. BEWARE the temperature knob after the unit has heated up though since there's no insulation and it gets hot so if you have to adjust you need to be quick.
customer_reviews.author: RobTheGamer

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This is a compact unit, bakes well, takes up little space, but must also realize that standard size 9X13 baking dishes will not fit into it. It has two racks so the larger meals have to be broken down into two smaller size pans. This is great for two. I do a lot of pot lucks, so sometimes it is not large enough to accommodate the larger items I would like to bake.
customer_reviews.author: joshar

customer_reviews.title: Buy this now!
customer_reviews.text: This is beyond what we expected. The beau thought I was crazy spending more than he would have liked, but he rotisseried a chicken last night and is constantly impressed with this oven. We do not use our oven at all anymore since it came out of the box! Get it now
customer_reviews.author: Mely B

customer_reviews.title: Capacity is somewhat deceptive
customer_reviews.text: Description is a little deceptive. While it will technically fit a 9x13 pan, if the pan has any handles it won’t fit.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Kobal

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t have a toast option! Seems to take a while to heat up to bake.
customer_reviews.author: Dplax

customer_reviews.title: Works nice but dials are cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: This countertop oven works well, and I use it for many things, almost daily. Had this for just over two months and the timer dial broke where it connects to the unit. so now I have no timer dial; have to use pliers to set it to always on and my own timer, as the timer can no longer work properly without knowing where zero is. Will be replacing with one that has a digital interface as I do not have a 3D printer to make a replacement dial.
customer_reviews.author: B. Everett

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster oven - large capacity!
customer_reviews.text: We loved this toaster oven! While doing a full kitchen remodel this was our main oven. It baked evenly and quicker than your normal oven (smaller surface size to heat up). It does get very hot on the outside but cools down quickly after use. Never had any issues with it. Will continue to use it when doing holiday cooking as a third oven!
customer_reviews.author: WhereDidIGoWrong

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Excellent over . Saves money over using full size oven. Good price
customer_reviews.author: bmf143

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control Issues at Hamilton Beach but overall a good product
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered sounded like a 747 doing a runup on the ground. I shipped that unit back to Amazon and received a replacement. The replacement unit is quiet and works very well. I especially like the convection cooking option. Foods cook much quicker and are more evenly heated. This makes a pizza cook all the way through without the edges burning. It would be a 5/5 if not for the original defective unit which other posts have commented on.
customer_reviews.author: C. SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it! Great size! Only complaint is it had a dent in the handle. Otherwise absolutely wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Chris DeLong

customer_reviews.title: Great lil oven
customer_reviews.text: Just a great lil oven holds 12 inch piazza and has safety buttons
customer_reviews.author: J. Donato

customer_reviews.title: I am so happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I live in my motorhome and this is my only oven. I can cook, literally, anything I want to cook in this oven. It has a ton of room and so many options! I am so happy with the purchase! I would recommend this oven to anyone looking for a smaller option to a full-size oven.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Moon

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Best gift ever. Bought it for my mom, and she loves it very much. So happy I got it for her.
customer_reviews.author: Marilla Williams

customer_reviews.title: Impressive counter top oven
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed by the extra large size. It is new yet so i report no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Whitmore

customer_reviews.title: Convection oven is a nice added feature over toaster oven
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time without any damage. Works well and small enough to be an advantage over using full size oven, but large enough to put 2 grocery store (10 inch?) pizzas in it. Convection oven is a nice added feature over toaster oven.
customer_reviews.author: GQ

customer_reviews.title: Big dissappointment
customer_reviews.text: The oven was a great disappointment. First, the timer never truely worked properly and eventually stopped working. Plus, the temperature has been inconsistent which made it a guessing game on how long to cook things.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Takes almost as much energy as the regular oven. ...
customer_reviews.text: Takes almost as much energy as the regular oven. It takes forever to make toast and to get up to temperature for baking. My wife refuses to use it. It only takes up cabinet space. Can't find any one who wants it.
customer_reviews.author: F. Joe Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Great size, Good price, easy to operate and bakes everything perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my mom. She is elderly and lives alone. A conventional oven is difficult for her to remove heavy, hot, dishes from. This oven has lots of room for good sized portions. It sits on the counter takes up a small corner. It cooks evenly and browns well.This was a very good investment and product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice oven. I use it to cook basically everything
customer_reviews.text: Very nice oven. I use it to cook basically everything. The original one I received the Convection fan was not working. I contacted Amazon and they had a new one sent to me the next day. Extremely satisfied with the level of customer service I received as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten C.

customer_reviews.title: Just not practical...
customer_reviews.text: WAY bigger than anticipated. Huge on the counter. Never got to test rotisserie functionality because it took 20 minutes to broil and toast my croissant. It'd be quicker to use the regular oven in my house. In the mornings I can't wait 20 minutes for my breakfast sandwich. I like broiling bagels with butter but it took 25 minutes for that. Returning it. It seemed great, don't use the big oven for a bagel or croissant and get a rotisserie since I eat a lot of chicken. But it's enormous and so slow to heat.
customer_reviews.author: anonymoose

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Beach countertop oven
customer_reviews.text: I really like this oven. It sits on my counter top and when I use it I just pull it out further away from walls, so size really isn't a problem. I use this instead of my big oven . Haven't used the rotisserie yet. I still prefer pizza in my pizza oven but it is okay for a pizza.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reimer

customer_reviews.title: Despite the many bad reviews I bought this oven mostly for its price ...
customer_reviews.text: Despite the many bad reviews I bought this oven mostly for its price and size, and I do not regret. The oven is really big and good looking. The noise is not so high as mention by other people, I have had other ovens before that are horribly noisy compare to this one. I will really recommend this oven.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Unit
customer_reviews.text: Works well, Thought I wanted rotisserie but ended up not using is much. Use convection and things cook more even and faster, which is what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Great appliance you must have enough room as it is ...
customer_reviews.text: Great appliance you must have enough room as it is quite large. I used it everyday during the holidays, what a help it was bakes cookies perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Morel

customer_reviews.title: Love the size
customer_reviews.text: Love the size! Fits a 12" pizza with space to spare. Good build quality. Been using for a short period of time and everything is working great.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Morton

customer_reviews.title: Love this oven
customer_reviews.text: Love this oven. I can finally put in multiple items at the same time and my family doesn't have to wait for their turn. Cooks well. Easy to use. Easy to clean. Loving the two story idea of an convention oven.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: I used to love it until today when it stared to smell from ...
customer_reviews.text: I used to love it until today when it stared to smell from the inside. smells like melted cables. I can not use it anymore
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Small dial writing
customer_reviews.text: Really do like this product BUT the dial writing is very small. Wish I got the digital. Oven does keep constant temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Warning! It gets hot all over.
customer_reviews.text: Too big. It gets hot all over. The only part that can be touched is the door handle. I miss my old GE oven , thay lasted many years, but is not longer available. I regret having bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: Juan O. Rivera Algarin

customer_reviews.title: Convection Oven
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this a few times so far. The rotisserie worked fine so far. We didn't notice any difference in oven vs convection cooking times. My 9x13 pans (glass or nonstick metal) have small handles on the ends so they won't fit in this oven. If I want to bake a cake in it I will have to find a new pan to do it with.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Bella

customer_reviews.title: Oven replacement
customer_reviews.text: My oven died and I needed something large enough for bundt cake pans and 9 x13 pans as well. This fits the bill. Great for broiling chicken, burgers, you name it. You can use it as a rotisserie for chicken. Very spacious inside. Fits perfectly on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Eloise L. Morrisey

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product. I have had great success with baking ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. I have had great success with baking things in it that come out well done and golden brown. You do have to rotate items half-way through to get even cooking since the oven is hotter in back than in the front. All settings are reliable and accurate. I love the convection feature. Be careful not to burn yourself on the door when you open it to take items out of the oven!!
customer_reviews.author: DJRK

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderful! I can put 9x13 pans in it with no problem. I love the rotisserie and the convection setting. I bought it because our full-sized oven stopped working and needs replacing. This appliance works so well that I may not bother to replace our oven.
customer_reviews.author: C Andre

customer_reviews.title: Gets really hot on the outside. Could have more cooking options.
customer_reviews.text: Gets really hot on the outside!! Could have more cooking options.
customer_reviews.author: Easy Trust

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I knew I would love but since I starting using it & wow it is far better than I thought! I love convection!!
customer_reviews.author: Belinda L.

customer_reviews.title: Love it, its perfect for light baking!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this oven to use while renovating out kitchen and love it. It's bigger than the usual counter top oven and gets the job done! LOVE the convection feature, we haven't tried the rotisserie feature yet.
customer_reviews.author: lelier

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I got a re-conditioned model and for the price, I am delighted. To clarify and reiterate other reviews... The housing is thin and gets hot. One can NOT fit a 9X12 inch baking pan in it. I was surprised the directions say do NOT use glass baking dishes. When baking two pies, one must switch shelves and turn the the pies so they bake evenly. We purchased this oven to use at our kitchenless dairy barn to use for a pie-baking workshop. Now, we continue to use it to heat up snacks and even cook breakfast! A great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 23 Months
customer_reviews.text: overall the oven was good while it lasted. Lasted us 23 months with normal use.
customer_reviews.author: Ferndozer

customer_reviews.title: This oven radiates quite a bit of heat which can be felt much too easily just standing near it
customer_reviews.text: It was not what I expected. It's a full-fledged oven and I was looking more in the way of a toaster oven with some baking and convection capabilities. This oven radiates quite a bit of heat which can be felt much too easily just standing near it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank H. Haddaway

customer_reviews.title: Great little oven
customer_reviews.text: Great little oven. My only complaint was I understood that a 13x9 baking dish would fit. I have 3 and none of them fit. Perhaps my dishes have extended edges to pick them up by but I was disappointed I could not use them.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Hicks

customer_reviews.title: I'll update but so far it's all good.
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once on bake and it worked better than the oven in my stove. The 10 minute preheat is kind of a pain but maybe that's why it works better than my oven, I never preheated it just added a few minutes to the cooking time.
customer_reviews.author: Micky

customer_reviews.title: Good product broils 1/2 chicken in about 30 minutes My ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product broils 1/2 chicken in about 30 minutes My only complaint is that the rotisserie does not have a basket and using the spikes on half a chicken it flops around even when using string .It just ain't practical .None the less I'm happy with it
customer_reviews.author: fly fishihg pete

customer_reviews.title: Great rotisserie and convection oven, but does not toast.
customer_reviews.text: Very practical, replaces a traditional oven in so many ways, with the added rotisserie! It does NOT have a toast function, though. That was a fail.
customer_reviews.author: Jess V.

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach 31103A Countertop Oven with Convection and Rotisserie, Metallic (Discontinued)
product_meta.description:
HAMILTON BEACH COUNTERTOP OVEN WITH CONVECTION & ROTISSERIE 31103
Small enough to fit on your kitchen counter, but large enough to help you prepare for any meal or party, the Hamilton Beach Countertop Oven with Convection & Rotisserie boasts full-size oven performance in compact, energy-efficient form.Designed with both kitchen style and practicality in mind, the Countertop Oven with Convection & Rotisserie is portable and countertop convenient. It's packed with versatile cooking options that range from baking cakes to crisping cookies to broiling salmon to roasting an entire 5 lb. chicken, roast or pork. There's no need to spend extra time cooking separate meals for the pickier ones, either. The wide interior and adjustable cooking racks provide double the space for cooking multiple foods at once.What's more, this oven is ideal for anyone, anywhere and anytime. It can replace the microwave in your office, offer easy cooking access for the elderly, serve as a staple for apartment dwellers or provide snack enthusiasts with a little added treat.


PRODUCT FEATURE BENEFITS
 * Uses 49% less energy than a typical kitchen oven
 * Extra-large capacity accommodates two 12" pizzas, two 9"x13" casseroles, two cake pans, two sheets of cookies or a 5 lb. chicken
 * Easy-clean, nonstick oven interior
 * Includes two oven racks, large enamel-coated baking pan, small baking pan and broil rack
 * Broil rack also stacks directly on small baking pan for roasting meats
 * Includes rotisserie accessories: rotisserie lift and forks with rod (skewer) Slide-out, full-width crumb/drip tray
 * Easy-to-read temperature dial on front control panel can be adjusted to desired or pre-set temperatures
 * Easy-to-read function dial on front control panel can be adjusted to four pre-programmed settings: BAKE, CONVECTION, BROIL, ROTISSERIE
 * Power indicator light
 * 2-hour cooking timer with audible tone and automatic shutoff

GIVES YOU THE CHOICE OF BAKE, CONVECTION, BROIL OR ROTISSERIE
Don't want to heat up the entire kitchen or slave away over a hot burner? No sweat – the Hamilton Beach Countertop Oven provides extra capacity for second oven convenience as well as four ways to cook: BAKE, CONVECTION, BROIL and ROTISSERIE.

A 9"x13" baking pan can be found in most kitchens in North America, used for making everything from lasagna to brownies. Not only does this oven fit two 9"x13" pans at once, unlike conventional ovens without convection technology, the Countertop Oven with Convection and Rotisserie comes fully equipped. Instead of having heat come from just one central area and no fan to "stir-up" or circulate air evenly all over, this oven's convection technology utilizes a top and bottom heating element and a built-in fan to distribute heat evenly for a uniform temperature. That way, bakers can choose between traditional baking – ideal for cupcakes, cakes and soft baked goods – or convection baking – ideal for a crispy pizzas, cookies or even taquitos. Use the rotisserie feature for roasted chicken, beef roast or pork roast. Note: Only upper heating elements will be on during the rotisserie mode.

TIPS & CARE
Before cooking with the oven, always PREHEAT for approximately 5 minutes. Check pan manufacturer's directions for oven-safe rating. Do not cover the crumb/drip tray or any part of the oven in aluminum foil (causes overheating); however, use of aluminum foil to partially cover casseroles or some foods is acceptable. Visit foodsafety. gov for more safe cooking temperature information.

The full-width crumb/drip tray slides out from the front, allowing easy washing. For the best oven performance, cleaning should be done regularly. Unplug first and allow oven to cool before interior and exterior cleaning. For interior cleaning: wipe oven walls, bottom tray and glass door with a damp, soapy cloth, but do not scratch or damage heating element tube. Repeat with a damp, clean cloth. All removable parts should be hand washed in warm, soapy water as well. For stubborn interior stains, use a plastic scouring pad. For exterior cleaning: wipe oven walls with a damp cloth, but do not use abrasive cleansers or metal scouring pads; this can scrape/scratch the surface.
feature_bullets: Extra-large capacity - fits two 12" pizzas, two 9" x 13" casseroles, or two cake pansThis oven is 110 voltage only It is packaged in SIOC packaging to avoid damage in shipping
Revolving rotisserie - meat self-bastes as it turns - fits a 5 lb chicken
Convection setting bakes faster and more evenly than traditional oven;Bake & broil settings with 2 hour timer1311 H x 2062 W x 1654 D
